hero.title: Your finances.
hero.subtitle: In one place.
hero.description: Connect bank accounts, track spending, and control your home budget with a secure API. No manual data entry.

features.title: What can Vaulte do?
features.subtitle: We use Open Banking technology to give you full control over your money.

items.title: Account Aggregation
items.desc: Connect accounts from PKO, Pekao, mBank, Revolut, and others into one clear view.

items.title: Smart Analytics
items.desc: AI algorithms automatically categorize your spending, detecting subscriptions and trends.

items.title: Budget Control
items.desc: Set limits for categories (e.g., 'Dining out') and receive push notifications.

pricing.title: Simple pricing plans
pricing.subtitle: No hidden fees. Cancel at any time.

basic.name: Basic
basic.desc: Perfect to start controlling the chaos in your wallet.

pro.name: Pro
pro.desc: Full automation and artificial intelligence for your finances.

business.name: Business
business.desc: For accounting offices, advisors, and companies needing API.

items.text: Finally, I can see all my expenses in one place. The integration works instantly.

items.text: Budget Tracker saved my finances before the holidays. Highly recommend Pro!

faqs.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faqs.subtitle: Everything you need to know about Vaulte security and features.

items.a: Security is our priority. We use AES-256 encryption and SSL connections...
We support over 20 institutions in Poland and Europe, including Revolut and major banks.
Currently, Vaulte focuses on data aggregation. Payment module (PIS) is coming in Q4 2026.
Yes. The subscription is monthly, and you can cancel with one click.

faqs.footer_desc: Can't find the answer you're looking for? Talk to our team.

hero.title: Vaulte Mission
hero.description: We want everyone to have full control over their finances. We believe that Open Banking is the future that belongs to the user, not the institutions.

history.title: Our History
history.p1: The Vaulte project was born in 2024 when we noticed how difficult it is to manage a budget while having accounts in three different banks. Logging into each of them, writing down expenses in Excel... it was a waste of time.
history.p2_end: directive to create one secure place that aggregates this data. Today, we are proud to help thousands of people save smarter.

plans.title: Manage your plan
plans.subtitle: Choose the option that fits your financial goals. Change at any time.

q1.title: Can I change my plan mid-month?
q1.answer: Yes. If you upgrade, the price difference will be charged proportionally. The change is instant, and you get access to new features immediately.

q2.title: How do payments work?
q2.answer: We support secure card payments (Visa, Mastercard) as well as Apple Pay / Google Pay. A VAT invoice will be sent automatically to your email after each transaction.

hero.title: Privacy Policy
hero.subtitle: We care about your financial security.

summary.title: In short:
summary.text: We do not sell your data. We never see your bank passwords. All data is encrypted (AES-256) and used solely to display your financial statistics.

s1.title: 1. Data Controller
s1.text: The controller of your personal data is Vaulte Sp. z o.o. based in Warsaw. You can contact our Data Protection Officer at: iod{'@'}Vaulte.pro.

items.account: Account data: email address, full name (necessary for login).
items.financial: Financial data (AIS): transaction history, balance, IBAN. This data is only fetched upon your explicit request via a secure API.
items.technical: Technical data: IP address, browser type, cookies.

s3.title: 3. Security (Open Banking)
s3.text: We use licensed third-party providers (TPP) operating in compliance with the EU PSD2 directive. When you connect a bank account:
steps: You are redirected to your bank's encrypted website.
You log in directly at the bank (we never see these credentials).
The bank sends us a secure, temporary "token" that allows us to fetch transaction history.

s4.title: 4. Who do we share data with?
s4.text: Your data may be processed by technical partners supporting our infrastructure (e.g., cloud providers, banking API providers). These entities process data only on our instructions and are bound by confidentiality.

s5.title: 5. Your Rights (GDPR)
s5.text: You have the right to: access your data, rectify it, erase it ("the right to be forgotten"), restrict processing, and data portability.

s1.title: ¬ß1. General Provisions
s1.p1: 1. These Terms and Conditions define the rules for using the Vaulte web application, available at Vaulte.pro.
s1.p2: 2. The service operator is Vaulte Sp. z o.o. with its registered office in Warsaw (00-001), entered into the register of entrepreneurs under KRS number 0000000000.
s1.p3: 3. The application is used for user financial data aggregation (AIS - Account Information Service) based on open banking APIs compliant with the PSD2 directive.

s2.title: ¬ß2. Account Rules
s2.p1: 1. Access to the full functionality of the service requires registration and creation of a User Account.
s2.p2: 2. The user is obliged to provide true data and protect the access password from third parties.
s2.p3: 3. Vaulte does not store the user's electronic banking login data. The login process takes place directly on the websites of banks or licensed integrators (TPP).

s3.title: ¬ß3. Payments & Subscriptions
s3.p1: 1. The service offers free and paid (Premium) plans.
s3.p2: 2. Subscription fees are collected in monthly cycles. The user may cancel the subscription at any time, maintaining access until the end of the billing period.

s4.title: ¬ß4. Liability
s4.p1: 1. The Operator makes every effort to ensure that the data presented in the Application is up-to-date, but is not responsible for delays resulting from the operation of bank APIs.
s4.p2: 2. The Application is analytical and informative in nature. It does not constitute investment advice within the meaning of the law.

s5.title: ¬ß5. Complaint Procedure
s5.p1: 1. Any complaints regarding the operation of the Service should be reported electronically to: pomoc{'@'}Vaulte.pro.
s5.p2: 2. Complaints are considered within 14 days from the date of their receipt.

hero.title: GDPR Information Obligation
hero.subtitle: Learn how we process your data in accordance with European regulations.

summary.title: Key information at a glance:
summary.item1: Your data is safe with us (encryption, banking standards).
summary.item2: We process it mainly to provide the service (account aggregation, analysis).
summary.item3: You have the right to request its deletion at any time ("the right to be forgotten").

s1.title: 1. Data Controller
s1.text: The controller of your personal data is Vaulte Sp. z o.o. with its registered office in Warsaw (00-001), at 12 Fintechowa St., entered into the register of entrepreneurs under KRS number 0000123456, NIP: 5250000000.

s2.title: 2. Data Protection Officer (DPO)
s2.text: We have appointed a Data Protection Officer whom you can contact regarding all matters related to the processing of personal data and the exercise of rights related to such processing.

s3.title: 3. Purposes and legal grounds for processing
s3.intro: We process your data for the following purposes:
s3.p1: Provision of electronic services (Art. 6(1)(b) GDPR) ‚Äì necessary for the performance of the contract (account creation, banking data aggregation).
s3.p2: Compliance with legal obligations (Art. 6(1)(c) GDPR) ‚Äì e.g., accounting, tax regulations, anti-money laundering (AML).
s3.p3: Analytical and statistical purposes (Art. 6(1)(f) GDPR) ‚Äì our legitimate interest in improving the application.
s3.p4: Direct marketing (Art. 6(1)(f) GDPR) ‚Äì informing you about new Vaulte features.

s4.title: 4. Data recipients
s4.intro: Your data may be transferred to entities processing it on our behalf, including:
items: IT and cloud service providers (e.g., AWS, Google Cloud).
State authorities (e.g., KNF, Tax Office) ‚Äì only when required by law.

s5.title: 5. Your rights
s5.intro: According to GDPR, you are entitled to:
rights: Right to erasure ("right to be forgotten")
s5.outro: You also have the right to lodge a complaint with a supervisory authority.

s6.title: 6. Data storage period
s6.text: We store data for the duration of having an account on the Vaulte service. After its deletion, data may be stored for the period of limitation of claims (usually 3 or 6 years) and the period resulting from tax regulations (5 years).

s7.title: 7. Profiling
s7.text: As part of the "Budget Tracker" service, we may use automated analysis of your spending (profiling) to suggest budget categories. However, we do not make decisions based on this that produce legal effects (e.g., credit denial).
